result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Joshua L Wheeler

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Joshua L Wheeler in court with attorney Michael L. Chernin.  Jon R Josephsen appeared on behalf of Alexander Dyer for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for Status Conference. Discussion with parties put forth on the record. Case remains calendared as previously set for Final Pre-Trial and Jury trial dates.

Defendant Joshua L Wheeler in court with attorney Michael L. Chernin.  Alexander C. Dyer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for Arraignment. Original Information filed. Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defendant pled not guilty. Defense counsel further advises that they have received discovery materials and an offer from the State. Court adjourns matter to Br 16.  Status conference scheduled for August 3, 2022 at 02:00 pm.  Final pre-trial scheduled for November 30, 2022 at 09:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for December 12, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Joshua L Wheeler in court with attorney Scott Alan Wales.  Jon R Josephsen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for arraignment. Request for Substitution of Judge received and filed.  Court consented to substitution against Judge Stark.  Parties are advised the Clerk of Circuit Court reassigned case pursuant to current court rules to Judge Grayson, Br. 16. Case adjourned to Branch 16 for an arraignment.  Arraignment scheduled for June 6, 2022 at 10:30 am.

Defendant Joshua L Wheeler in court with Attorney Michael L. Chernin; both appear by video.  Erika Strebel appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Stark, Branch 17.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defense requests an arraignment date.  Arraignment scheduled for May 17, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Adjustment Number: 22A 041324,
Payable Number: 1003202,
Receipt Number: 22RP017345,
Amount: $20.00

$2,500.00 Cash bail that was previously posted to remain. 
No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Jeremiah Wheeler.

Defendant Joshua L Wheeler in court with attorney Amanda M. Parent.  Mallory R Davis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Stark, Branch 17. Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings. Defendant intends on hiring private counsel.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 28, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Actual Date Bond Posted with * Sheriff
03-03-2022
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on April 18, 2022 at 1:00 PM.  jm
